# Compiler Messages Docs

## C# compiler messages

- [C# compiler messages](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/index.md): C# Compiler Errors
- [Preprocessor errors](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/preprocessor-errors.md): Learn how to diagnose and fix errors related to preprocessor tokens how they're used in C# source files.
- [Attribute declaration and usage](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/attribute-usage-errors.md): These compiler errors and warnings indicate errors in attribute declarations, or attribute use in your code.
- [Feature or version missing](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/feature-version-errors.md): Several compiler errors indicate that your configured language version doesn't support a feature you're using. This article shows how to fix those errors and warnings.
- [Assembly references](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/assembly-references.md): These compiler errors and warnings indicate incorrect or missing assembly references. These errors cause missing or incorrect definitions for types in your program.
- [Constructor declarations](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/constructor-errors.md): These compiler errors and warnings indicate violations when declaring constructors in classes or structs, including records. This article provides guidance on resolving those errors.
- [Property declarations](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/property-declaration-errors.md): Use this article to diagnose and correct compiler errors and warnings when you define properties in your types.
- [Operator declarations](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/overloaded-operator-errors.md): This article helps you diagnose and correct compiler errors and warnings when you declare user-defined operators in your types
- [Parameter / argument mismatch](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/parameter-argument-mismatch.md): These errors and warnings are issued when arguments are missing or arguments can't be used for one or more parameters on a method. Learn how to diagnose and fix them.
- [Generic type parameters and type arguments](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/generic-type-parameters-errors.md): These compiler errors and warnings indicate errors in generic type parameters and type arguments.
- [Asynchronous methods](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/async-await-errors.md): These compiler errors and warnings indicate errors in the syntax for declaring and implementing `async` methods that use the `await` expression.
- [Interface implementation](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/interface-implementation-errors.md): These compiler errors and warnings indicate errors in declaring methods that implement an interface member.
- [Reference parameters](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/ref-modifiers-errors.md): The compiler issues these errors and warnings when you use the reference parameter modifiers incorrectly. They indicate a mismatch between the modifier on the parameter, the argument, or the use of the parameter in the method.
- [Ref safety](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/ref-safety-errors.md): The compiler issues these errors and warnings when the referent of a reference variable might not be valid. These errors prevent you from creating dangling references.
- [ref struct types](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/ref-struct-errors.md): Learn about errors and warnings related to `ref struct` types. The compiler enforces several restrictions on `ref struct` types to enforce ref safety rules
- [Iterator methods](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/iterator-yield.md): Use this article to diagnose and correct compiler errors and warnings when you write iterator methods that use `yield return` to enumerate a sequence of elements.
- [Extension declarations](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/extension-declarations.md): These errors and warnings indicate that you need to modify the declaration of an extension method using the `this` modifier on the first parameter, or an extension declaration
- [Partial declarations](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/partial-declarations.md): Use this article to diagnose and correct compiler errors and warnings when you write `partial` types and `partial` members.
- [Params modifier](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/params-arrays.md): This article helps you diagnose and correct compiler errors and warnings when you use the `params` modifier on method parameters.
- [Nullable warnings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/nullable-warnings.md): Several compiler warnings indicate code that isn't null-safe. Learn how to address those warnings by making your code more resilient.
- [Pattern matching warnings](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/pattern-matching-warnings.md): There are several pattern matching warnings. Learn how to address these warnings.
- [String literal declarations](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/string-literal.md): Learn how to diagnose and correct C# compiler errors and warnings when you declare string literals, including basic strings, raw strings, and UTF-8 strings.
- [Array declarations](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/array-declaration-errors.md): These compiler errors and warnings indicate errors in the syntax for declaring and initializing array and collection variables. There are multiple valid expressions to declare an array. Combining them incorrectly leads to errors. Collection initializers and collection expressions provide initial values for an array or collection.
- [Inline arrays](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/inline-array-errors.md): These compiler errors and warnings are generated when you create an inline array struct that is invalid. This article helps you diagnose and fix those issues.
- [Lambda expressions](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/lambda-expression-errors.md): This article helps you diagnose and correct compiler errors and warnings for lambda expression declarations and usage.
- [Overload resolution](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/overload-resolution.md): Compiler errors and warnings that indicate a problem in your code related to overload resolution. Learn causes and fixes for these errors.
- [Restrictions on expression trees](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/expression-tree-restrictions.md): These compiler errors and warnings indicate that an expression would include an expression that isn't allowed in an expression tree. You need to refactor your code to remove the prohibited expression.
- [Using directive and aliases](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/using-directive-errors.md): These errors and warnings indicate problems with using directives and using directive aliases. This information helps diagnose and fix those issues.
- [Using statements and declarations](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/using-statement-declaration-errors.md): These errors indicate an incorrect use of the `using` statement or `using` declarations. Learn about the errors and how to fix them.
- [Source generators](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/source-generator-errors.md): You might see these errors and warnings when code is compiled with source generators and interceptors. They indicate some condition where the compiler can't run the source generator, or the generate code isn't compilable.
- [static abstract interface members](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/static-abstract-interfaces.md): These warnings and errors are generated when static abstract or virtual members are used incorrectly. Learn how to correct these errors.
- [Thread synchronization](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/lock-semantics.md): This article helps you diagnose and correct compiler errors and warnings when you use the `lock` statement.
- [Dynamic expressions](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/dynamic-type-and-binding-errors.md): These errors indicate an incorrect use of the `dynamic` type or an expression with runtime (or dynamic) binding. Learn about the errors and how to fix them.
- [Unsafe code](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/unsafe-code-errors.md): These compiler errors and warnings indicate errors when you work with `unsafe` code. Unsafe code must be enabled with the `unsafe` keyword. Unsafe code allows constructs that can introduce memory based errors. These warnings and errors explain common misuses.
- [Warning waves](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/warning-waves.md): C# warning waves are optional warnings that can be reported on code where previously a warning isn't reported. They represent practices that could be harmful, or potentially elements that might be breaking changes in the future.

## Error messages

- [CS0001](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/cs0001.md): Compiler Error CS0001
- [CS0006](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/cs0006.md): Compiler Error CS0006
- [CS0007](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/cs0007.md): Compiler Error CS0007
- [CS0015](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/cs0015.md): Compiler Error CS0015
- [CS0016](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/cs0016.md): Compiler Error CS0016
- [CS0019](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/cs0019.md): Compiler Error CS0019
- [CS0029](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/language-reference/compiler-messages/cs0029.md): Compiler Error CS0029
